answers.author: Amanda Dodge
answers.text:
Hi Pamela,    
I am not entirely sure that this is what you are looking for, but I have found a few examples of documents used by police departments to collect customer satisfaction survey information. For the most part it seems as though police departments randomly select individuals who have recently had contact with the department to send (via letter or email) a very simple survey.     
Some examples of the format of these surveys are:    
The Oakland, California Housing Authority Police Department:    
www.ohapd.org/attachment/BrochureCustSatisAdm.pdf     
The LaSalle, Ontario, Canada Police Department:    
www.police.lasalle.on.ca/pdf/CommunitySatisfactionSurvey.pdf     
Examples of reports once they have been compiled are:    
The San Fernando Police Department, which conducted its survey by telephone:    
http://www.ci.san-fernando.ca.us/city_government/departments/police/Citizen%20Satis%20Survey%202010.pdf 
The 2010 Victoria, Texas Executive Summary of their online survey results which not only outlines how the department distributed the survey, but also results, lessons learned, and next steps:    
http://bit.ly/e6xsCz 
Let me know if that answers your question, and if not I can try and find different resources.    
Amanda Dodge    
Knowledge Network Intern    
ICMA    
202-962-3699    
adodge@icma.org

answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Hi, 
The following surveys may be useful to the Alliance member. The first is from Vancouver and is perhaps more aligned with your question. You can view the online survey here: http://www.cityofvancouver.us/police.asp?policeID=34414&policeSubID=34420. 
The second survey is from City of Bonney Lake and its intent is to get the evaluation of the quality of service that the Police Department has provided. It can be found here: http://www.ci.bonney-lake.wa.us/section_government/departments/police/community_service/citizen_survey.shtml
The third survey is from Sequim, WA and focuses more on its citizens to propose what the department should focus its  resources in the future. I hope this helps.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is asking if there are PDs that have done their own customer satisfaction surveys for non-emergency service delivery, communications, etc?   Not professional surveys with a consultant or firm but for ex: do they follow-up with people who have had in person, or by phone, or by website, etc contact with the Police Department as a means for improvement.
Thank you,
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Police Dept Surveys
